title: `[aria-*]` attributes do not match their roles
description: Each ARIA `role` supports a specific subset of `aria-*` attributes. Mismatching these invalidates the `aria-*` attributes. [Learn how to match ARIA attributes to their roles](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/aria-allowed-attr).

node.snippet: <button type="button" role="tab" id="slick-slide-control10" aria-controls="slick-slide10" aria-label="1 of 4" aria-pressed="false" aria-current="false" tabindex="-1">
node.explanation:
Fix all of the following:
  ARIA attribute is not allowed: aria-pressed="false"

node.snippet: <button type="button" role="tab" id="slick-slide-control11" aria-controls="slick-slide11" aria-label="2 of 4" aria-pressed="true" aria-current="true" tabindex="0" aria-selected="true">
node.explanation:
Fix all of the following:
  ARIA attribute is not allowed: aria-pressed="true"

node.snippet: <button type="button" role="tab" id="slick-slide-control12" aria-controls="slick-slide12" aria-label="3 of 4" aria-pressed="false" aria-current="false" tabindex="-1">
node.explanation:
Fix all of the following:
  ARIA attribute is not allowed: aria-pressed="false"

node.snippet: <button type="button" role="tab" id="slick-slide-control13" aria-controls="slick-slide13" aria-label="4 of 4" aria-pressed="false" aria-current="false" tabindex="-1">
node.explanation:
Fix all of the following:
  ARIA attribute is not allowed: aria-pressed="false"

title: Elements use prohibited ARIA attributes
description: Using ARIA attributes in roles where they are prohibited can mean that important information is not communicated to users of assistive technologies. [Learn more about prohibited ARIA roles](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/aria-prohibited-attr).

node.snippet: <a id="main-content" data-uw-rm-kbnav="anohref" tabindex="0" aria-label="Open this option" data-uw-rm-empty-ctrl="">
node.explanation:
Fix all of the following:
  aria-label attribute cannot be used on a a with no valid role attribute.

title: Elements with an ARIA `[role]` that require children to contain a specific `[role]` are missing some or all of those required children.
description: Some ARIA parent roles must contain specific child roles to perform their intended accessibility functions. [Learn more about roles and required children elements](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/aria-required-children).

node.explanation:
Fix any of the following:
  Element has children which are not allowed: li[tabindex]

title: `[role]`s are not contained by their required parent element
description: Some ARIA child roles must be contained by specific parent roles to properly perform their intended accessibility functions. [Learn more about ARIA roles and required parent element](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/aria-required-parent).

node.snippet: <a href="#tabs-1" class="nav-link active" role="tab" data-bs-toggle="tab" aria-selected="true" data-uw-rm-brl="PR" data-uw-original-href="https://www.ccd.edu/about/vision-mission-strategic-plan#tabs-1">
node.explanation:
Fix any of the following:
  Required ARIA parent role not present: tablist

title: Background and foreground colors do not have a sufficient contrast ratio.
description: Low-contrast text is difficult or impossible for many users to read. [Learn how to provide sufficient color contrast](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/color-contrast).

node.snippet: <a href="https://www.facebook.com/CCDEdu" target="_blank" class="fab fa-lg fa-facebook-f nav-link fabfa-lgfa-facebook-f nav-link-https--www…" data-uw-rm-brl="PR" data-uw-original-href="https://www.facebook.com/CCDEdu" aria-label="Facebook - open in a new tab" data-uw-rm-ext-link="" uw-rm-external-link-id="https://www.facebook.com/ccdedu$facebook">
node.explanation:
Fix any of the following:
  Element has insufficient color contrast of 2.78 (foreground color: #0079c0, background color: #313131, font size: 0.0pt (0px), font weight: normal). Expected contrast ratio of 4.5:1

title: List items (`<li>`) are not contained within `<ul>`, `<ol>` or `<menu>` parent elements.
description: Screen readers require list items (`<li>`) to be contained within a parent `<ul>`, `<ol>` or `<menu>` to be announced properly. [Learn more about proper list structure](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/listitem).

node.explanation:
Fix any of the following:
  List item parent element has a role that is not role="list"
